body: Which of the following energy carriers is involved with moving TRNA from one site on a ribosome to another?

In the immune system, antigen receptors on T and B cells are specific to certain antigens. When detected, these antigens promote proliferation for those specific T or B cells. What is this process called?

Researchers at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory are studying the ways in which muscle contraction is affected by different types of toxins. One of the toxins they are studying is known to bind to calcium, and prevent it from binding on to what troponin subunit?

Scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Lab are studying the properties of plasmas in stellar bodies. In Cepheid variables, the opacity of these plasmas varies periodically which drives an oscillation in radius of the star. What is the name of this pulsation mechanism?
What effect, often seen in octahedral complexes, stabilizes nonlinear molecules through geometrical distortion that forces nondegeneracy?

Identify all of the following 3 changes that would increase the Van't Hoff number of the given compound in aqueous solution: I) Increasing the concentration of acetic acid II) Increasing the temperature of NaOH III) Encouraging dimerization in propanoic acid
Due to the neutrino's lack of charge and peculiar preference for handedness, it is possible that they are what kind of particle, which is its own antiparticle?

A coil of wire carrying a current is fixed in a magnetic field parallel to the axis of the coil. Which of the following statements are true of this situation? I) The coil feels a force radially, squeezing it together or pulling it apart. II) An opposing EMF is generated in the wire. III) The coil feels a force parallel to the field.
Consider the equation $x^{2} - by^{2} = 25$. Which of the following values of b will create the graph of an ellipse with a vertical major axis?
How many positive integers x exist such that $\rac{1080}{6^x}$ is an integer?
Identify all of the following 3 cells that are haploid: I) Megasporocyte II) Synergid cells III) Antipodal cells
What is the term for the circuit in amphibians that sends blood to both the lungs and the skin at the same time?
Which of the following accurately describes warm core rings in the North Atlantic Ocean?

choices.W: They derive their warm insides from the Gulf stream
choices.X: They are regions of low biological productivity
choices.Y: They form south of the Gulf stream

answer: $\athrm{X)}$ They are regions of low biological productivity

body: Which two major soil horizons are not present in aridisols?

Green Hope, Panther Creek, and Green Level each scrimmaged each other four times in Science Bowl this year. Enloe played each of those teams twice. How many total games were played among those four teams?
What is the integral from $-3\i$ to $4\i$ of $2x - \in (x)dx$ ?

Researchers at SLAC are using the LINAC coherent light source to study the geometry of molecules. Which of the following best explains why VSEPR [vesper] hybridization can be inadequate in describing molecules such as $\athrm{SF}_6$ ?

choices.W: $\athrm{SF}_6$ electrons do not have enough energy to fit into d orbitals
choices.X: $\athrm{SF}_6$ does not have an octahedral geometry like predicted
choices.Y: VSEPR [vesper] theory does not accurately predict electron spins in $\athrm{SF}_6$
choices.Z: VSEPR [vesper] theory does not accurately predict resonance in $\athrm{SF}_6$

answer: $\athrm{W)}$ $\athrm{SF}_6$ electrons do not have enough energy to fit into d orbitals

body: Researchers at Argonne National Lab are studying ways to increase the efficiency of large energy storage systems. Diodes and transistors are some of the most important components used to control the flow of electricity. What phenomenon, which leads to losses and unintentional discharge of electricity, occurs when charge slowly travels across a diode or transistor in reverse bias?
In classical mechanics, Lagrangian mechanics can be used to predict how a system will evolve over time. What 2 terms make up the Lagrangian for mechanical systems?

Thanush is messing with Nikhil again, this time trying to freeze him to death. He uses a Carnot refrigerator with a coefficient of performance of 1.5 to cool the room Nikhil is in. If the heat transferred to the hot reservoir is 12 Joules during a cycle, what is the total work transferred into the engine in one cycle?

Brian is observing a binary star system of two stars, A and B. Over a long period of time, Brian can see star A oscillating back and forth over 12 arcseconds in his telescope, and he sees star B oscillating back and forth over 2 arcseconds in his telescope. What is the ratio of the mass of star A to the mass of star B?
Order the following 3 Martian surfaces from oldest to youngest: 1) Amazonis Planitia 2) Hesperia Planum 3) Noachis Terra
The electron configuration of nickel is often used as both [Ar]4s23d8 and [Ar]4s13d9. Which of the following best explains why both of these configurations can be considered valid?

choices.W: Nickel is commonly found in an excited state
choices.X: Different isotopes of nickel have different ground state configurations
choices.Y: The excited state of the nickel nucleus affects which electron configuration has the lowest energy
choices.Z: Fine structure splitting causes overlap between the two configurations' orbitals

answer: $\athrm{Z)}$ Fine structure splitting causes overlap between the two configurations' orbitals

body: Order the following 3 molecules in order of increasing ring strain per carbon: 1) Cubane 2) Tetrahedrane 3) Cyclobutadiene
Which of the following best describes the structure of collagen?
Edwards syndrome is a trisomy of what chromosome?
Which of the following is not a polymorph of quartz?
Order the following ore minerals in increasing density. 1) Wolframite 2) Hematite 3) Pyrolusite
What is the number of 8 inch by 8 inch tiles needed to cover a floor measuring 8 feet by 6 feet?

Brian has a rod of length 16 meters. He splits the rod into n equal pieces and multiplies the length of each piece together to obtain a new number, k. What value of n should Brian choose so that k is maximized?

In NMR spectroscopy, magnetic nuclei are perturbed out of alignment with a magnetic field and undergo precession as they come back into alignment, emitting radiation in the process. What property of a nucleus explains why it precesses as it realigns with the field?

Brian has decided to create a new unit system called the BBB system from the following base units: Bohr radius, BTU, and Boltzmann constant. Identify all of the following 3 quantities that can be represented in the BBB system: I) Temperature II) Time III) Volume
When conducting chromatography, which of the following mobile phases would be most commonly used alongside a silica gel stationary phase?

In the backbonding of a conjugated alkene ligand to a central metal atom in a complex, the HOMO d orbital of the metal donates into the LUMO pi star orbital of the conjugated system. How do the bond angle and bond length of the alkene change during backbonding, respectively?
What process, commonly used by environmental scientists in wildlife conservation efforts, uses organisms to add essential materials to a degraded ecosystem?
Identify all of the following 3 intermediates in the C4 cycle that are a 3 carbon molecule: I) Oxaloacetate II) Malate III) PEP

Brian, who is your average NCD enthusiast, decides that he wants to manufacture a bioweapon in Kaiwen's garage, and realizes that he needs to introduce plasmids to bacteria. Which of the following is not a type of transfection that he could use to introduce the plasmids?
Researchers at Brookhaven National Lab are studying black holes. The entropy of a black hole is directly proportional to what physical property of the black hole?
The characteristic absorption line for a type 1a supernova at 615 nanometers is produced by what specific chemical species?
Which of the following is true of Jupiter's great red spot?

choices.W: Its color is derived from hematite
choices.Y: It moves westward along the surface of Jupiter
choices.Z: It is in Jupiter's northern hemisphere

answer: $\athrm{Y)}$ It moves westward along the surface of Jupiter

body: What type of isomerism occurs in two compounds where the atom of a ligand bonded to the central metal atom is different?
As temperature increases, which of the following best describes how the vapor pressure of a solid changes?
A spring mass oscillator is immersed in a viscous liquid. Which of the following happens to the resonant frequency when the viscosity of the liquid increases?

Identify all of the following 3 changes that would increase the amount of energy dissipated as Cherenkov radiation from a charged particle at some given wavelength of radiation: I) Increasing particle charge II) Increasing magnetic permeability III) Increasing electric permittivity
Triangle PQR has side lengths $\athrm{PQ} = 6$ and $\athrm{PR} = 10$. Point S lies on side QR such that line segment PS bisects angle QPR. If $\athrm{QS} = 3$, what is the length of SR?
What is $\im_{x \to 0^{+}} x \n x$?
